Marcel Breeuwer

professor and principal scientist, TU/e, Philips Healthcare

Interests

  • Clinical application of medical image computing, modeling, advanced visualization
  • Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
  • Magnetic Resonance Imaging
  • Neurology
  • Music

Education

  • MSc Electrical Engineering - Information Theory

    TU Delft

  • PhD

    VU Amsterdam

Projects

  • Real-time fMRI neurofeedback

Biography

Marcel Breeuwer is a part-time professor in the Medical Image Analysis group of the Biomedical Engineering department and Principal Scientist in the MR Clinical Science department of Philips Healthcare. His focus is on the clinical application of image analysis and visualization, and on computational modeling applications for supporting the care of patients with cardiovascular disease, neurological disease, or cancer. His expertise is in data compression; image-guided surgery; medical image analysis and visualization; cardiovascular disease; neurology; oncology; and research project management.
